expressions.meaning: espresso coffee
expressions.exampleTranslation: An espresso, please.

expressions.meaning: tram
expressions.exampleTranslation: Let's catch tram 28.

expressions.meaning: neighbourhood (used much more in Lisbon culture)
expressions.exampleTranslation: I live in Bairro Alto.

expressions.meaning: very / a lot (youth slang, originated in Lisbon)
expressions.exampleTranslation: That's really cool!

expressions.meaning: big nerve / audacity (Lisbon slang)
expressions.example: Que granda lata! Furou a fila toda.
expressions.exampleTranslation: What nerve! He cut the whole queue.

expressions.meaning: espresso coffee (Porto word, from the La Cimbali machine brand)
expressions.example: Um cimbalino e um pastel de nata.
expressions.exampleTranslation: An espresso and a custard tart.

expressions.meaning: person from Porto (from tripas — tripe, their traditional dish)
expressions.example: Os tripeiros são orgulhosos da sua cidade.
expressions.exampleTranslation: People from Porto are proud of their city.

expressions.meaning: person from Lisbon (literally 'little lettuce')
expressions.example: Ele é alfacinha, nasceu em Lisboa.
expressions.exampleTranslation: He's from Lisbon, born there.

expressions.meaning: exclamation of surprise (Porto/northern slang)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Wow, it's so hot!

expressions.meaning: hey dude / hey man (very Porto)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Hey man, shall we go to Majestic?

expressions.meaning: exclamation (mild swear — like 'damn')
expressions.exampleTranslation: Damn, I forgot my wallet!

expressions.meaning: traditional cheap restaurant/bar (more common term in the north)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Let's have lunch at that tavern.

expressions.meaning: boy/girl, young man/woman (used much more in the Algarve)
expressions.exampleTranslation: That young woman is very friendly.

expressions.meaning: cute / pretty / elegant
expressions.exampleTranslation: What a pretty dress!

expressions.meaning: in a rushed/messy way
expressions.exampleTranslation: He did the work in a rushed, sloppy way.

expressions.meaning: morning fog / sea mist (common in the Algarve coast)
expressions.example: Há cacimba de manhã, mas à tarde abre.
expressions.exampleTranslation: There's mist in the morning, but it clears in the afternoon.

expressions.meaning: still / yet (contraction of ainda)
expressions.exampleTranslation: I haven't eaten yet.

expressions.meaning: dude / mate (Azorean slang, literally 'ox')
expressions.exampleTranslation: Hey dude, everything alright?

expressions.meaning: traditional sweet bread from the Azores
expressions.example: A minha avó faz a melhor massa sovada.
expressions.exampleTranslation: My grandmother makes the best sweet bread.

expressions.meaning: Cory's shearwater (seabird, iconic sound of the Azores at night)
expressions.exampleTranslation: At night you can hear the shearwaters.

expressions.meaning: potato (Madeira word)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Do you want potatoes with meat?

expressions.meaning: traditional Madeiran drink (aguardente, honey, sugar, citrus)
expressions.example: Tens de provar a poncha quando fores à Madeira.
expressions.exampleTranslation: You have to try poncha when you go to Madeira.

expressions.meaning: popular street festival / outdoor celebration
expressions.example: O arraial do Monte é o mais famoso da Madeira.
expressions.exampleTranslation: The Monte festival is the most famous in Madeira.

expressions.meaning: basket / hamper (also used for gift hampers at Christmas)
expressions.example: Recebi um cabaz de Natal com vinho e queijo.
expressions.exampleTranslation: I received a Christmas hamper with wine and cheese.

expressions.meaning: kid / young person (used everywhere but especially northern)
expressions.exampleTranslation: That kid is very naughty.

expressions.meaning: very cold (northern slang)
expressions.exampleTranslation: It's freezing cold out there.

expressions.meaning: guy / girl (informal, slightly rough — used everywhere)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Do you know that guy?

expressions.meaning: dude / man (universal interjection, short for rapaz)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Dude, I can't believe it!

expressions.meaning: deep longing / nostalgic yearning (untranslatable — the most Portuguese word)
expressions.exampleTranslation: I miss Portugal deeply.

expressions.meaning: to improvise a solution / to manage / to get by (a core Portuguese cultural concept)
expressions.exampleTranslation: Don't worry, I'll figure it out.
